meanings.sent1: I will rephotograph the beautiful sunset tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The photographer decided to rephotograph the old building for her portfolio.
meanings.sent3: After realizing the first picture was blurry, she had to rephotograph it.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to rephotograph the scene with a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: He carefully rephotographed the rare bird in its natural habitat.

meanings.definition: To take a photograph of something that has already been photographed.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to rephotograph the famous landmark during her trip.
meanings.sent2: The magazine editor asked the photographer to rephotograph the cover image.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to rephotograph the picture on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The student had to rephotograph the historical document for the school project.
meanings.sent5: The photographer was excited to rephotograph the iconic city skyline.
